sample_rows.Use Case Title *: ME LO PURIFIER STOP WHILE ME RUN
sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *: SMARTShip Notification suggested ME LO PURIFIER STOP WHILE ME RUN. After confirming the trueness of the alarm, the condition was communicated to the TSI.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *: TSI communicated to the vessel to start the ME LO Purifier. The vessel acknowledged the same by starting the ME LO Purifier and the notification was reset.
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: Carbon, metal particles, water, and fuel residues from combustion and wear continue to accumulate and can cause abrasive wear in the journals and bearing including clogging of oil passages.
sample_rows.Screenshot *\n1) Upload SMARTShip Screen: 3943 GENCO AUGUSTUS ME LO PURIFIER STOPPED WHILE ME RUN.png
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 2 - Office finds abnormality before the vessel staff

sample_rows.Use Case Title *: ME FO IN PRESS URE LOW
sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *: SMARTShip Asset AI Anomaly indicated ME FO IN PRESSURE LOW while ME run. On confirming the same in RMD and noticing the decrease of ME FO Pressure in the system, the status was reported to TSI.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *: On TSI's communication, the vessel checked and found that ME FO filter was dirty. Same was cleaned and alarm reset.
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: Incomplete combustion leading to lower power, misfiring and knocking leading to loss of efficiency. Stoppage of ME can also result in restricted waters or traffic leading to severe consequences amounting to huge financial loss for the owners in terms of compliance and also damage to the environment.
sample_rows.Screenshot *\n1) Upload SMARTShip Screen: 3944 GENCO TIGER ME FO PRESSURE LOW.png
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 2 - Office finds abnormality before the vessel staff

sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *: SMARTShip Observation indicated GE#3 TRIP CIRCUIT FAIL. On confirming the running of the generator, the status was communicated to the TSI.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *: TSI reverted that coill not receiving proper voltage due to wiring fault. Same rectified and the alarm reset
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: The trip circuit normally  disconnects the generator during faults like Earth faults, Short Circuit or Overload. If this fails, Inablity to automatically isolate the generator during the said faults can lead to MSB protection tripping causing Black out on ship.
sample_rows.Screenshot *\n1) Upload SMARTShip Screen: 3945 GENCO LION GE#3 TRIP CIRCUIT FAIL.png
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 2 - Office finds abnormality before the vessel staff

sample_rows.Use Case Title *: ME JCFW P/P not changed over for more than 6 months
sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *: SMARTShip Observation indicated ME JCFW P/P not changed over for more than 6 months. The situation was notified to the TSI.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *: TSI communicated the same to the vessel and the pumps were changed over. Notification was reset
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: Internal parts of pumps may seize due to corrosion and salt crystallisation. Motor bearings may fail due to prolonged inactivity.
sample_rows.Screenshot *\n1) Upload SMARTShip Screen: 3946 Genco Tiger ME JCFW Pump not changed over.png
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 2 - Office identifies gaps in operating procedures on board

sample_rows.Use Case Title *: CARGO HOLD NO 1 Bilge well Level High
sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *: SMARTShip Notification indicated CARGO HOLD NO 1 Bilge well Level High. After confirming the vessel loading condition, same was reported to the TSI.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *: On TSI's communication, the cargo hold bilge well was pumped out and the alarm reset.
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: Hull Structural damagedue to corrosion from standing water. Violation of IMO codes leading to Port detention. Loss of stability on Dry bulk Carriers can lead to castastropic consequences leading to loss of life.
sample_rows.Screenshot *\n1) Upload SMARTShip Screen: 3947 CARGO HOLD BILGE WELL HIGH LEVEL.png
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 2 - Office finds abnormality before the vessel staff

sample_rows.Description Of Event: Fire detection system fault alarm was activated from B deck (Centre) Manual call point. Investigation and troubleshooting carried out and found the manual call point (Loop 1 Zone-3, address 38) PCB faulty.

During the inspection, fuel shut off valves of axillary engines No1 and 2 were not activated when the remote control was triggered (testing was undertaken three times without a good outcome). In addition, was observed that PMS procedure did not specify what QC valves were required to be tested in quarterly basis (Last testing july 2022, so no objective evidence was found about the periodic testing of aforementioned valves.
X band radar found not picking up targets

1. On 08 Oct 2022 Steering gear alarms were tried out as pre-arrival routines. All alarms were tried out satisfactory. 2. After testing completion, the AUTO PILOT was switched ON and a Warning Alarm appeared on bridge AUTO Pilot HMI Screen. Alarm "B-10552 Time out 10 AP CDU(MPU) was active" and was not resetting. 3. As per the nature of the alarm, wrong/delayed communication was suspected between AP CDU (Control and display unit) and MPU unit. MPU unit inspected for abnormal indication and all connections checked for integrity and tightness. Found all terminal contact intact and tight. The Alarm did not reset by powering ON/OFF of CDU and MPU unit. No further information given about trouble shooting iin the instruction manual.
Intermittent alarm on Fire panel.
While sailing to SanNicholas from Barra Dos on 19.07.2022 at around 10:00 LT,vessel was on autopilot and suddenly started swinging port side and alarm started comming "error 3, A".
Alarmed was arised and the fault that is indicated in the panel is Fault 169 ( Central 1 board LB3 11 Long Boot) and Fault 128 ( Central 1 Board LB3 11 No Answer).

15:18 Hrs 20-08-2022 : Vessel arrived and anchored at B anchorage in Fujairah. 22:25 Hrs 20-08-2022 : Bunker barge A/S 02:24 Hrs 21-08-2022 : Bunker Barge Casted off after completion of bunkers. 02:28 Hrs 21-08-2022 : Contacted Port Control for permission to heave up anchor 02:30 Hrs 21-08-2022 : Permission granted to heave up anchor 02:42 Hrs 21-08-2022 : M/E Stby, Commenced heaving STBD anchor. When the anchor chain came up to 2 shackles on deck, observed chain having a lead of 4 Oclock short stay, and unable to pick up the anchor any further. Then the anchor was lowered to the sea bed and resumed heaving, but when it came to 2 shackles on deck, observed chain not coming up any further. 03:30 Hrs 21-08-2022 : Reported to the port control about suspect anchor foul, enquired any foul history at this location, port control replied having no history. Repeated above procedure few more times by changing vessels heading / angles, but to no avail. 04:20 Hrs 21-08-2022 : Informed Agent 04:25 Hrs 21-08-2022 : Informed charterers. Vessel is unable to clear the anchor by herself, monitoring the anchor position.. standby, awaiting for shore assistance. 1652 Hrs / 21-Aug-2022 : Anchor handling offshore vessel Diva arrived along side 1700 Hrs / 21-Aug-2022 : Three Ships lines made fast on Anchor handling vessel DIVA. 1707 hrs / 21-Aug-2022 : Commenced clearing the foul on anchor. 1806 Hrs / 21-08-2022 : Anchor cleared and secured Home. 1848 Hrs / 21-08-2022 : All lines casted off from Anchor handling vessel DIVA / Vessel Underway. 2000 Hrs / 21-08-2022 : Exit from Anchorage B. 2100 Hrs / 21-08-2022 : RFA.
Incinerator unable to Burn Sludge

S-Band RADAR error. A) Targets seen/painted when you run the S-Band RADAR from standby, however targets will remain the same without any movements after few seconds. B) Observed S-Band screen display is frozen right after running from standby. C) No data received when acquiring the targets.

We noticed something abnormal at our Engine Control Console Monitoring System - 31 August 2022 Maker: Uzushio Electric Model: BEMAC (BE-D10) False Alarms are coming to our stand-by generators & once started everything is coming back to normal condition. We are suspecting that the Digital Master Unit are in fault  kindly confirm with the makers. Trouble shooting has been carried-out  see attached document with marked colors & photos for your reference. In the alarm history  it shows February 05.36 whereas today date is August 30, 2022 Awaiting advice from the makers so we can proceed with the ordering of the required parts.
ROT PV Valve was found to be leaking. Upon investigation it was observed that pressure disc was not sitting properly on upper house valve seat.

At 0300lt on 05 Sep 2022, OOW found RADAR X - BAND( Marker / model: FURUNO / FAR 2827) not showing the trails of the RADAR echoes of targets. OOW checked RADAR X-BAND some times following manual instruction but it is not successful. After that we tried to restart and checked PM test but RADAR X BAND still not showing the trails of the RADAR echoes of targets. RADAR X-BAND TX TIME: 4825 hrs. Life expectancy of magnetron TX as per manufactures instructions is 4000 hrs.

01 Sep 2022 1500 Lt:During SIRE pre check, It was found that spare magnetic compass card was dislocated from the spindle 1500 LT: Informed Master 1505 LT: Commence Inspection and Trouble shooting 1545 LT: Completed Trouble shooting and identified vessel shall require shore assisstance 1600 LT: Informed Office with evidences

sample_rows.Sub Component: Lifebuoy with Smoke and Light (MOB Marker)
sample_rows.Description Of Event: On 20 Oct 2022 , 1700 LT: During routine safety rounds it was observed that the port side lifebuoy self activating smoke signal was found leaking. The Smoke signal for MOB marker is expiring on Dec 2022.
Lifeboat engine tachometer not working

WHILE THE VESSEL WAS UNDER PILOTAGE ON 05.07.2022 APPROACHING TO BERTH # 1 ,STURE OIL TERMINAL,NORWAY, AT LOCAL TIME 0815 HRS ,S-BAND RADAR STOPPED GIVING PICTURE ON THE SCREEN, SHIPS STAFF TRIED VARIOUS SETTING BUT IT DID NOT WORK, PILOT WAS INFORMED ABOUT THE PROBLEM, INTER SWITCH USED FROM X-BAND, AND VESSEL BERTH SAFELY AT 1048 LT. VESSEL STARTED TROUBLE SHOOTING RADAR WITH MAKERS AND OFFICE AFTER OBTAINING TERMINAL PERMISSION AS THERE WAS NO CARGO OPERATION DUE TO DELAY FROM TERMINAL SIDE , THERFORE TROUBLE SHOOTING WAS IN PROGRESS AS LONG AS THERE WAS NO CARGO OPERATION AND IT WAS FOUND THAT X-BAND HAS ALSO DEVELOPED SIMILAR PROBLEM.
After berthing, when trouble shooting on Radars, it was found that X band was also not showing echoes.

Please note vessel received false fire alarm in pump room smoke detector AO113 & AO114 on 2nd and 3rd deck respectively. Checked smoke detector 113 on the 2nd platform and found detector contacts loose, same tightened and initialized the system satisfactorily. Checked smoke detector 114 on the 3rd platform, Checked cable condition and tightened the terminal for loose connection, cleaned the detector filter and reinstalled the detector. After reinstalling the detector received BLC fault alarm 1. BLC eq & 2.BLC-eq , point fault alarm for smoke sensor AO114 to AO119 & other fault Operation Zone. Replaced detector AO114 with available spare new Ex smoke detector but the problem persists. All the Faults mentioned above are not getting reset from the main control panel on bridge. Vessel tried testing other loops and observed that main control panel is not accepting any of the input.
Fire line in ER and Steering Flat to renew
AIS FEED IS NOT RECEIVING IN VOYAGE DATA RECORDER DISPLAY
Incinerator Electrical equipments and connections burnt due to High temperature occured on the cooling spaces.
While taking round in Engine room it was noticed that leakage from 45 Litre moblie portable foam extinguisher near Aux Engine #3.

sample_rows.Sub Component: Waste Oil Service Tank Heating Coil
sample_rows.Description Of Event: 1)On 17th July 2022, during UMS round at night, Waste Oil tank for Incinerator High Level alarm activated. 2)Since the level was maintained below alarm level, so ship staff carry out investigation, and found that, level of Thermal Oil Expansion tank reduced by 150 ltr.

sample_rows.Sub Component: Associated Valves in Hyper Mist System
sample_rows.Description Of Event: During routine try out of Hyper mist System, Vessel observed Motor operation valve(MOV) for Aux.Boiler was non-operational in auto mode due to damage motor gear teeth.

sample_rows.Sub Component: Waste Oil Service Tank Heating Coil
sample_rows.Description Of Event: 1)Heating temp of Waste oil tank for Incinerator is not coming up for Evaporation. 2)Upon investigation, vessel found Thermal oil inlet valve to the heating coil is not operating fully as per temp setting, causing tank temp rises only up to 70  C , which is not enough for evaporation of waste oil.
During engine room rounds it was found that engine room hypermist system power on local operating panel is not available. due to which system is not operating in auto mode.

During routine inspection of STBD side life boat found batteries no. 1 & 2 are drained could not start the lifeboat engine and the battery voltage severely dipped till 8 Volt DC even while charging. Later batteries had been removed and charged externally but still the condition remains same. As per the record both the batteries were installed on 30th August 2021

During routine check found x-band Radar PM (performence monitoring) not in range as per manufacturer requirements. Last magnetron renewed on 04th May'22 at Singapore. Target detection is good but Pm some times appearing only. Vessel is in contact with maker- Furuno thorugh TSI for troubleshooting.
Forward Windlass and mooring winch hydraulic blocks and lines found badly corroded and started leaking during operation.
UPS for VSAT found to be malfunctioning. It is not able to relay 220V input VSAT .Currently connected directly with ships supply with no back up of UPS.
All three Liferafts service was due in June 2022
AIS malfunctioned feed stopped coming. AIS showing error msg (064 .A.V. mkd connection lost)

sample_rows.Sub Component: Air Horn/ Motor Siren/ Marine Bell
sample_rows.Description Of Event: Fore electric whistle Motor broken

Starboard Lifeboat engine failed to start when trying it out. Starting wiring connections checked, motor was removed from its place, solenoid coil unit was overhauled (terminal contactors part not opened as it is sealed unit), motor was then fitted back in place, tried out multiple times and found working satisfactory. Vessel has made requisition for new spare starting motor assembly.
When X-Band Radar, after heaten, display alert MTR(DATA) and MTR( Status) , can not transmit

When pumping out Bilge water through 15 ppm equipment, it was observed that after passing through the Green box unit, the flowmeter still showing zero reading and is not showing actual flow after doing flow initialisation also. Vessel received Error Fault alarm in Fire detection system on 12/july/2022 UTC 2310Hrs. Following troubleshooting steps carried out. 1. Following alarm received in Fire Detection system 142 LOOP ANALOGUE 2 NEG CABLE BREAK/SHORT CIRCUIT. 2. As per maker manual above alarm is due to broken wire or short circuit in detector. 3. For same troubleshooting carried out. And found all ER alarms are connected in LOOP 2 MX. 4. In Loop 2 MX input and out signal voltage checked and found satisfcatory. ( 11,12,13,&14 terminal) 5. Total 77 ER detectors are found connected to LOOP 2 MX. 6. On further troubleshooting vessel found out on Zone 7 smoke detector 43 power supply for negative cable was showing open. 7. For further investigation, same old detector replaced with new programed detector and tried out. No change in alarm status. 8. Base unit removed for inspection and found the base unit PCB faulty. As shown in attached. Req No SPR/BGMR/E/22/045 for smoke detector base.

Vessel encountered severe weather from 3rd to 6th January 2021. On 7th Jan AM hours, once the weather improved to wind BF-5,swell 3~3.5mtrsit was decided to take deck rounds to assess damage and lashing requirements, if any. After the toolbox meeting, the crew had checked; anchor securing arrangements, booby hatches, hatch covers, both combination ladders and gangways till lunch break. Vessel identified two unsecured garbage bins moved out from the stowed position at the cross deck between the break of accommodation and aft of cargo hold 7. The Chief Officer instructed the bosun to secure the same after lunch. The bosun was advised to inform W/house of deck activities and be in contact through a walkie talkie. While carrying out the job, a freak wave washed over the deck and severely injured 3 seafarers. The seafarers were treated on board until next port, where they were signed off and completed recovery at home port inPhillippines, under office supervision. There were no permanent injuriesto any of the personnel and nodanageto the vessel.

Vessel was discharging Ceara Mar Crude oil via Manifold 3 Starboard.



1730LT oil spill

1735LT Clean up operation initiated.

1745LT Maersk incident Duty informed by phone.

1830LT Written report (Q17) to incident  duty.

1842LT Suspend  Discharge 

1845LT Called Petrobras Duty Mobile - No answer

1848LT Called  Petrobras back-up Duty Mobile - No answer

1842LT to 1930LT Awaiting terminal crew to change to Manifold #1 Starboard.

1930LT to 2106LT Inspection by Terminal Safety officer .

2106LT  Resume Discharge

2130LT Informed Petrobras by email.

2230LT Cease communication with CASTNKINT



1730 the spill was noticed and all crew mustered on deck and initiated clean up operation.

Oil on deck was mainly in port side as vessel had heel to port. 

No oil entered the water and the vessel was brought upright with no heel to minimize the risk of oil floating over the side.

The spill was estimated to about 200 litre.

The leak was located to Wilden Pump body  in the MARPOL line midships.

The leak was expected to be pressure build up in the line after the Wilden pump.

The pressure in the line was released by opening the valve on the discharge side of the Wilden Pump and let the pressure drain to the residual tank.

At 1842LT in was noticed, that the level in the residual tank was raising, and the discharge operation was stopped.

At that time it was realized, that the drain valve at Manifold #3S and inlet valve for Wilden pump was leaking.

The terminal was requested to attend and change discharge manifold to Manifold #1S.

The vessel was inspected by the Terminal Safety Inspector before cargo operation resumed.

After completion the difference in residual tank between arrival and departure was measured to 84m3 together with Terminal representative.

Vessel was detained by PSC at Antwerp due mainly to corrosion on deck._x000D_
_x000D_
PSCO visited on 11-Jan-2019 at ANtwerp while vessel was loading a cargo of gasoline._x000D_
_x000D_
During deck rounds they indicated that they considered the wastage/corrosion on deck structures a case for detention. Vessel management and attending technical superintendent  tried to show the repair plan and measures already in place for upgradation. LR surveyor was called to assist the vessel. However, the PSCO were unconvinced._x000D_
_x000D_
PSC left the vessel with a provisional report and a detention order and advised that they would re-visit on 14th Jan._x000D_
_x000D_
On 14th Jan LR surveyors and P&I surveyors attended with PSC. PSC inspected 2 WBT. Eventually, they maintained the detention order and issued a revised inspection report. It was decided that they would re-visit on 18th Jan._x000D_
_x000D_
Senior Steel superintendent joined vessel on 17th Jan to assist and to draw up a repair plan acceptable to PSC and LR._x000D_
_x000D_
On 18th Jan PSCO visited with apparently a senior member of the PSC authority. After much discussion with LR and with their superiors on phone, they maintained the detention and asked LR for a survey report basis which they could lift the detention. Their revise was again scheduled on 21-Jan._x000D_
_x000D_
Vessel has started corrective action on 11th Jan with shore workshop assistance but the result of the recification was not acceptable to PSC._x000D_
_x000D_
On 19th Jan vessel shifted to layby berth in Antwerp after completion of cargo work and continued rectification of the deficiencies._x000D_
_x000D_
On 21st Jan PSC returned with LR surveyors and lifted the detention. Some items were basis Class conditions/Actionable Items._x000D_
_x000D_
Vessel shifted to Wandelaar Anchorage and rectified the deficiency related to Manhole covers with shore assistance after tank cleaning and gas freeing.

Vessel had just completed heaving up Port Anchor at Tubarao Anchorage on 16-Jan-2019 at 2154 Hrs LT, Personnel at Anchor station noticed a small hydraulic leak near cargo pump no. 1 port._x000D_
_x000D_
FRAMO Hydraulic system was shut down using emergency stop, alarm was sounded and all personnel proceeded to a clean up the leaked hydraulic oil and to inspect the cause of the leak._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
At 2156 Personnel confirmed all Scuppers were plugged and that all oil was contained within bays below the Cargo Pump 1 Port, however due to location of the gash on the hydraulic oil supply line to the cargo pump some oil had sprayed onto the pipelines and bays inboard from port to starboard side and from aft of no. 1 port to midway of no. 2 cargo oil tank._x000D_
_x000D_
All Oil, about 50 to 60 ltrs was contained on deck and no oil spilled overboard._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
Vessel proceeded to the pilot station to pick up pilot at scheduled time and pilot was onboard on 16-Jan-2019 at 2248 Hrs LT. Pilot boarded the vessel and was informed of vessels hydraulic leak and upon agreeing mutually, vessel reduced her speed to await satisfactory completion of checks._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
Vessel completed checks, venting of hydraulic line, and then pressure testing of hydraulic system on16-Jan-2019 at 2330 Hrs LT and advised pilot of completion of checks._x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
_x000D_
Vessel proceeded normally to the berth and was all fast at the terminal on 17-Jan-2019 at 0130 Hrs LT._x000D_

On April 28, 2023, at 2144 LT, Petite Soeur, with pilot onboard and the dredger Hong Hai 189 collided in the TSS off Corregidor, at the entrance to Manila Bay. Both vessels sustained damage as a result of the incident. The incident caused the Hong Hai 189 to capsize, resulting in two casualties and three missing crew members. 15 crew members were rescued by another vessel. The collision occurred during nighttime, under clear visibility conditions, and within the designated vessel traffic management service (VTMS) area.

sample_rows.Benefit Area \n(OKR Category): C1 - Improve Vessel Reliability and Availability
sample_rows.Use Case Details/Description: MAC Cut-in and Cut-off setting were very close and this was leading to frequent starting and stopping of MAC. Air Compressor run count per day found more than normal. Both air bottles in Use and Compressor cut in/out setting found too close. 22.6-24.6 bar. TSI advised vessel to make it at 20-27 bar.
sample_rows.Root Cause/Action/Remarks: Same has been corrected and run count has come down .We are further liaising with ship staff to adjust the settings to maintain one compressor as STBY.
sample_rows.Consequence/Impact:
Frequent Start/Stop could have led to failure of Valves, Breakers etc. By reducing the frequency, Life time of affected parts will improve considerably. 1. Prevented undue reliability impacts/stress during the start of compressors due to frequent start/stop
2. Potentially reduced high compressors run hours and saves cost from maintenance.
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip: 2 - Data analysed and helped as Decision Support System

sample_rows.Benefit Area \n(OKR Category): C1 - Improve Vessel Reliability and Availability
sample_rows.Use Case Details/Description: Compressor Run count for Frontier Leader noted to be high.
sample_rows.Root Cause/Action/Remarks: Vessel was carrying out deck maintenance with pneumatic equipment which led to excessive consumption of air and resulted in higher run count
sample_rows.Consequence/Impact: Basis the study, we have decided to supply one Deck Air Compressor to save on expensive spares of Main Air Compressor.
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip: 2 - Data analysed and helped as Decision Support System

Potential reduction in maintenance cost and usage of major spare parts avoided.

sample_rows.Parameter: Cyl 7 Exh Gas Temp vs Power
sample_rows.AOT Remarks: Unit Operating at slightly high temps 395 C against ML Baseline of 350 C  for the reported time. Avg exh gas temp is 380 C for the reported time. This alert is mainly attributed to the average exhaust gas temp increasing 30C with respect to the baseline over time; unit 7 is the highest of the cylinders, but still close to the average.
sample_rows.TSI Comments - if any: No action taken since engine/ Unit 7 parameters were within normal limits at regular speed.
sample_rows.Root Cause: Alert triggered during a brief period of reduced speed operation. Engine/ Unit 7 parameters and exhaust gas temperature are within normal limits while measured at full speed and same confirmed through maker's performance evaluation report dated 01 Aug 2021.
sample_rows.Action Taken: No action taken since engine/ Unit 7 parameters were within normal limits at regular speed.
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip: 2 - Data analysed and helped as Decision Support System
sample_rows.Title: Main Engine - Cyl 7 Exh Gas Temp vs Power Anomaly

sample_rows.AOT Remarks: Scav Air Press it Operating 0.25 bar above the ML baseline. This is more observable at higher loads
sample_rows.TSI Comments - if any: Kyma shaft power meter calibrated and scavenge air coolers cleaned
sample_rows.Root Cause: The operating point of the engine was plotted and found to be operating in light running condition. The engine was continually operating at reduced/eco speed. During the present voyage, the vessel has been required to operate above 90%MCR to meet the fuel consumption target. That is why the derived parameter has deviated from the base value. Kyma shaft power meter has been calibrated at the last port and scavenge air coolers cleaned. No further action is required and engine performance seems normal.
sample_rows.Action Taken: Kyma shaft power meter calibrated and scavenge air coolers cleaned
sample_rows.Remarks for Cost Avoidance: No cost impact, since main engine operational parameters were normal
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip: 2 - Data analysed and helped as Decision Support System
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact: The potential impact of the derived parameter notification is uncertain, since there has not been a change in parameters even after action was taken. There is also no precedence to this derived parameter at the present engine RPM. The alert would be restored to normal condition as the engine RPM is reduced to normal operating range.

sample_rows.Use Case Title *: Asset AI Observed for Aux # 2 TC in A Vs Power
sample_rows.Benefit Area *\n(OKR Category): C1 - Improve Vessel Reliability and Availability
sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *:
Asset AI Anomaly was observed,We have noted gradual rise in AE 2 TC in Temp. in past few months. The following Asset AI Anomaly was observed for Aux Engine # 2 in Smartship.
        The Anomaly was for T/C in A Temp Vs Power.
        The T/C in A temperature is gradually increasing when compared to the Previous Readings.
        The T/C in A temperature was noted as 431*C @ 240 KW in May, 438*C @ 243 KW in June, and 451*C @ 240 KW July.
Request to kindly advise/Note the following:
1.        When was the TC of AE 2 last cleaned?
2.        Is any routine coming due for AE 2 TC?
3.        To which units of AE 2, the TC In A reading is connected.
4.        Any routine coming due for AE 2.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *:
The Cause of alarm being that engine room temperature is gradually increasing from 35Deg C on 16th May 2022 to 47 Deg C on 13th July 2022. This may case gradual increase in exhaust temp and TC in temp.   1.        When was the TC of AE 2 last cleaned?
Ans: As per records AE2 TC was cleaned on 5th Jan 2022. RH since cleaning is 1843 as on today 
2.        Is any routine coming due for AE 2 TC?
Ans: No
3.        To which units of AE 2, the TC In A reading is connected.
Ans: 1,2 &3
4.        Any routine coming due for AE 2.
Ans: Fuel valves overhauling will be due after 250hrs.
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *:
Damage to TC, All unit of AE exhaust temperature rise, 
AE not taking full load due to high TC exhaust temp
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 1 - Increased transparency and reduced communication with vessel

sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *:
The following observation was made on SMARTShip.
        The Aux Eng #3 lube oil priming pump was found stopped.
        The pump was stopped from 0802 hrs to 1227 hrs.
        Kindly advise the nature of work carried out on Aux Engine # 3.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *:
The  Aux Engine 3 lube oil priming pump was stopped for cleaning lube oil filter and centrifugal lube oil filter. 
Priming pump was re started after completing the maintenance work
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: Nil as it was a planned maintance.
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 1 - Increased transparency and reduced communication with vessel

sample_rows.Benefit Area *\n(OKR Category): C1 - Improve Vessel Reliability and Availability
sample_rows.Use Case Details / Description *:
The ME Shutdown / Slowdown alert was triggerd on SMARTShip.  ME Shotdown /Slowdown Alert.
        The Main Engine RPM was observed to have reduced from 101 RPM at 2054 hrs to 44.3 RPM at 2100 hrs.
sample_rows.Root Cause / Action Taken / Remarks *:
The Slowdown occured  at 2323 hrs on 13th July 2022 due to ME jacket cooling water high temperature. 
Running jacket cooling water pump #1 tripped which caused the high temperature. Immediately #2 Jacket cooling water pump started and  Main engine speed increased gradually. All parameters are within normal range. Kindly note that JCW Pump 1 motor coupling disconnected. Noticed pump shaft was not free at one point. 
Dismantled the pump and cleaned all parts. Mouth rings, impeller and shaft were checked and found in satisfactory condition.
Pump boxed back with new gaskets and packing. Motor insulation checked and found satisfactory.
Motor connected with pump and electric connections made. Pump shaft is free to rotate .After stopping main engine, pump will be tried out.
sample_rows.Potential Consequence / Impact *: Will lead to Stoppage of Main Engine.
sample_rows.Role of SMARTShip *: 2 - Data analysed and helped as Decision Support System

sample_rows.Details of Incident: After departure from port Aomori on 10-Jan-2022 RFA given at 11:30 LT and at 12:42 LT vessel received ME slow down activated due to sudden collapse of the main engine unit#2 ext. valve and turbocharger surging, Vessel also received alarm Exhaust valve stroke too low (3.1MM), and Exh.closed position changed (slow down) CCU2_03023210 on MOP, there was knocking sound observed from the unit# 2 exhaust valve housing, at the time of incident vessel was at 88.6 RPM (NCR). Vessel could not be stopped due to maneuvering in congested waters. ME Unit#2 isolated with Zero fuel setting on MOP and Ext. valve disabled fo

sample_rows.Details of Incident: During regular operation of EGCS SOx Scrubber system, reduction in performance of the operational S.W. Feed Pump  the Ballast & IGG Cooling Sea Water Pump was observed. During this ballast passage it was noted that, when Main Engine RPM was increased to 84 rpm, the Jet Section S.W. pressure was falling to 0.85 bar with activation of low pressure alarm - PT_A2002  Low Limit reached. Flow rate of the Ballast & IGG Cooling Sea Water Pump was observed to be 710-720 m3/hr., Discharge Pres. 3.7 bar.

sample_rows.Details of Incident: On 14th May 2022, M/E LO Auto backwash filter DP Alarm was activating continuously since 0700 Hrs. LT. & continuous manual backwashing was done (As Auto mechanism is out of service) -At around 0833 Hrs. LT. Main Engine Auto shutdown was activated. -Immediate cause was M/E HCO Main filter DPH on Aconis panel, which was followed by Low inlet pressure to HPS pumps on MOP Panel followed by Auto shut down. -Note: # M.E LO Auto backwash filter & HCO Main filter drain lines are interconnected & lead through the sludge checker to the MELO Sump. #HCO Main Filter Auto backwashing is initiated by hydraulic motor which gets oil supply from inlet to the filter & outlet is lead to the drain line which goes through the sludge checker to the MELO Sump. # M/E LO Auto back wash filter auto mechanism is out of service & manual back flushing carried out at 1-hour interval. 14th May 2022, at 1830 Hrs. All parameters were under observation, At around 1830 Hrs. LT all parameters were normal, except the auto backwashing movement of the HCO Main filter which has again slowed down & was about to stop. Sludge checker filter back pressure checked & found to be around 1.5 Bar. (This parameter was not noticed at 1st instance) This indicated chocking of the sludge checker filter, which slowed the oil movement through the hydraulic motor which drives the HCO Main filter auto backwashing arrangement. In order to avoid another slowdown, decided to check the condition of Sludge checker filter, the inlet valve to the sludge checker filter was shut & all parameters were under observation so as to check if it will initiate any alarm. Again M/E HCO Main filter DPH on Aconis panel activated, which was followed by Low inlet pressure to HPS pumps on MOP Panel followed by Auto shut down at around 1844 Hrs. LT. As engine was shut down, immediately sludge checker filter was removed & inspected. Found slight sludge formation, it was cleaned with 6 bar air & fitted back in place. Engine was started again. Found sludge checker filter back pressure 0.2 bar & HCO main filter auto backwash movement was back to normal. 16th May 2022, at 0445 Hrs. After 34 Hours, found Sludge checker filter back pressure has increased to 1.5 Bar again & HCO Main filter backwashing movement has completely stopped.

sample_rows.DETAILS_OF_INCIDENT: The vessel was proceeding towards South Killinghome Jetty in Immingham. This was a low water berthing, Low water was at 14:30 hrs Vessel was to berth Port Side Alongside (final tie up 4+3 FWD and AFT) The Captain, Chief Officer and the pilot were on the bridge. Engine, Thruster and helm controls were on the port bridge wing console The tug "Switzer Kathleen" was attached by tugs line to the main deck (aft of manifold - forward of accommodation ladder). ON 10-FEB-2023 at 1454, the vessel had sent first lines ashore, via heaving lines (2 foreword and 2 aft springs) The vessel was parallel to the berth and moving alongside, the SOG was less than 1 knot. At the time of mooring, due to tide level, the vessel's main deck was level with the top of the jetty. The bow of the vessel (FRAME 143-144) made a hard landing to the jetty structure. There was no damage to the jetty. The vessel completed the mooring operation and was all fast on 10-FEB-203 at 15:48. The area was inspected after all fast, and the damage reported. The vessel reported q17 and complied with the instructions sent.

Weather the situation during the stop described below. PTTGC East Jetty 2 : Mooring sequence alongside fwd 4 headlines 2 brestlines 2 springlines aft 4 sternlines 3 brestlines 2 springlines (all ropes) Ships heading alongside berth 180 deg Weather the situation during the stops described below. Wind Force: 4-3 ( falling ) Wind Direction: NE Sea state: 2 Air temperature: 30 partly cloudy Broken tube in air cooler on St Air Compressor no 3. was filling the Cooling water system with air 19:30 Engineer on watch had the 1 st Alarm. Air condition compressor, When he comes down, he can see that water is overflowing from funnel (FW Expansion tank).He calls CE and I am down shortly thereafter. Inlet and outlet valves for condensers on Air condition no 1 is closed (As this was the first alarm).Thought that the air/gas there was coming into the cooling water system was coming from A/C Condenser (But it was Cooling water was displaced from AC Unit so no cooling => High pressure on AC Unit and not as first thought). All Engine crew is coming (Fire alarm/plenty Alarms) and we start filling the FW Expansion tank.Alarms from AEs indicate that the cooling is not ok !!!!!Start de-areation from the AEs 19:37 Blackout .Main air compressor no 3 found with failure on top cover and is stopped and cooling water valve closed. 20:41 AE 3 SHD/Safety sys. Normall Generator startet/connected Main Power ok 21:30 found that the LT Cooling water pumps have air trapped in/around the impeller and they not is circulating any/less cooling water, started de-areation from cooling water pumps. 21:40 Second blackout 21:58 Started up of Aux Engines when LT Cooling water pumps was de-areated. 23:04 Start of Inert Gas Generator 23:05 Stop of Emergency Generator Back to "normal" but still with a lot of air trapped in Cooling water system Short excerpt of alarms 19:30:37 Engineer on watch had the 1 st Alarm. Air condition compressor, followed by 19:29:59 IGS Plant 19:29:59 19:30:11 Earth Failure 19:33:14 No 3 Main Air Compressor 19:34:04 ER Center Bilge well level 19:32:05 Fire Alarm I am (CE) Coming down 19:34:09 FW Expansion tank level low 19:35:25 FW Expansion tank level Normal 19:35:12-29 No1/2/3 A/E CFW Inlet pressure 19:36:27 AE 3 SHD/Safety sys. Alarml 19:37:08 AE 2 SHD/Safety sys. Alarml 19:37:36 AE 1 SHD/Safety sys. Alarml 27.12 19:42 Black out and Emergency generator starts and take over. Cargo discharge suspended, terminal informed, manifold closed.Troubleshooting has been carried out; Was a hole in the tube in the cooler on starting air compressor no 3 between stage 1 and 2. The leak meant that compressed air, was pressed into the cooling water system and displaced 2.6 m3 of water in the cooling water in the system. (Out of the expansion tank and down to the bilge wells) No cooling water Circulated in the system meant that the Aux Engine was stopped because of high cooling water temperature as they should. (So no failure on AE/Generator) Cooling water was filled into the expansion tank and at the same time was the cooling water system vented on Aux Engines, High Temp / Low Temp Cooling water pumps and other placed where the air had gathered. (it just take time with a small filling valve/pipe) CE -> CPT 2 hrs and we will bew ready 19:48:24 FW Expansion tank level low 20:19:46 FW Expansion tank level Normal 20:19:46 FW Expansion tank level Normal 20:41:55 AE 3 SHD/Safety sys. Normall Generator startet/connected Main Power ok 20:53:03 AE 2 SHD/Safety sys. Normal 21:06:23 AE 1 SHD/Safety sys. Normal 21:07:18 AE 2 SHD/Safety sys. Alarml 21:19:24 AE 2 SHD/Safety sys. Normall 21:30 CE-> Cpt we will be ready at 23:00 21:35:55 AE 1 SHD/Safety Alarm 21:40:26 AE 3 SHD/Safety Alarm Second blackout 21:58:07 AE 3 SHD/Safety Normal Generator startet/connected Main Power ok 22:19:02 AE 1 SHD/Safety Normal Continuously De-areation from cooling water system 23:05:15 Stop of Emergency Generator 27.11 2318 Resume 28/00:16:32 Last bilge well empty 01:30 Engine crew leaving ER l 28.11 0318 Completed discharging 28.11 0348 Tank inspection 28.11 0354-0400 Loading arm disconnected 28.11 0406 Received shore figures 28.11 0406 Documents Completed 05:08:47 Engine room attended for departure. 07:52:51 FW Expansion tank level low 07:55:45 FW Expansion tank level Norma 28.11 0618 Pilot onboard 28.11 0624-0636 Unmooring. 28.11 0648 Pilot off
Mooring Tail Parted Mooring Lines not Tended frequently throughout the port stay. Duty Watchkeepers to be more vigilant.

sample_rows.DETAILS_OF_INCIDENT: While climbing up the staircase in the engine room, Mr Pramodekumar Aromal/2nd Engineer, missed his step and landed awkwardly on his left leg, thereby twisting his left knee.

Fitter was given job of renewal of Hatch cover Hydraulic line square flange O-ring. In order to remove nuts/bolts, which was apparently jammed, he used electric grinder to cut the nut/bolts. Due to congested area of work, electric grinder slipped from fitter's hand and hit on his knee area and got a superficial cut injury above the left knee.

Left hand thumb 1st degree burn while handling the hot cooking oil pan in galley. 04 Aug 2022 1545 hrs LT GS was shifting hot vegetable cooking container from one hot plate to another, while shifting due to improper lifting practice hot cooking oil splash and drop fall on GS left thumb, which causes blister on skin.
Coupling of air hose from pressurized airline hit leg of AB below knee in tibia bone area, causing minor injury in the area of impact.

During toolbox meeting, Job was planned to carry out the scavenge & under piston space cleaning by Vijay Sirohi, Harjinder Singh & Keval Narsinhbhai Tandel. While Mr. Vijay Sirohi was inside the scavenge space for cleaning, Mr. Keval Narsinhbhai Tandel was stby for assistance outside the scavenge. At 14:50 Hrs Lt Mr. Vijay Sirohi asked for assistance & while passing from scavenge entrance portable blower which was hanged at opening got hit by Mr. Keval Narsinhbhai Tandel & resultant of that blower guard mesh fall down & rags was in hand of Keval Narsinhbhai Tandel got sucked in blower blade & as he tried to remove the same rag without switching off blower, his left hand palm came in contact with blade & causes the injury.

sample_rows.DETAILSOFINCIDENT: During disconnecting cargo blocks hook and grab on 27 Aug 2024 at Salalah, OSs left shoulder (Mr. KIZHAKKEMATTEL SHAJI SHIBIN) impacted with cargo blocks hook and it caused his lieft shoulder pained. In the first day, there was slight swelling. Cold compression was given followed by hot compression in 2nd day and inn 3rd day with application of turpentine oil. However, the swelling was subsided in the 3rd day after 2 days rest and light work. No pain killer was given but the crew still complaints of some pain in the shoulder area.
